intro: Alismorkis angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf water plantain, is a species of aquatic plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows in shallow, freshwater environments such as ponds, lakes, and slow-moving streams. The plant has long, narrow leaves that are usually submerged or floating, with small white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late summer. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Alismorkis angustifolia plays an important role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for small aquatic organisms and contributing to water filtration.
